definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: Generalists need to be versatile and open to failure.
sentences.chinese: 通才需具备多方面才能，且勇于面对失败。

sentences.english: Product managers do not need to excel in every aspect of their job to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 成功的产品经理当然也不大可能是个通才。

sentences.english: This is an era in which specialists thrive and generalists do not.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个专才吃香而通才无用的时代。

sentences.english: LIBERAL】They want their children to have a liberal education.
sentences.chinese: 他们要他们的孩子接受通才教育。

sentences.english: I love the idea of being a generalist.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢成为通才的这种观念。

sentences.english: In my opinion, it is necessary to become both specialist and generalist.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，成为专家和通才都是必要的。

sentences.english: Liberal arts colleges are schools that focus on a comprehensive undergraduate academic experience.
sentences.chinese: 文理学院是专门注重学生的通才教育的学校。
创业家必须要成为通才。

sentences.english: Chapter Six tries to reveal the practical or immediate significance of Mei's thought.
sentences.chinese: 第六章揭示了梅贻琦通才教育思想的现实意义。

definition: conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
